content.question: Which of the following scales is played?

choices.label: Descending scale notated in bass clef. A-3, G3, F3, E3, D3, C3, B2, and A2.
Descending scale notated in bass clef. A-3, G-sharp 3, F-sharp 3, E3, D3, C3, B2, and A2.
Descending scale notated in bass clef. A-3, G-sharp 3, F-sharp 3, E3, D3, C-sharp 3, B2, and A2.
Descending scale notated in bass clef. A-3, G-sharp 3, F-sharp 3, E3, D-sharp 3, C-sharp 3, B2, and A2.

content.answer: Descending scale notated in bass clef. A-3, G-sharp 3, F-sharp 3, E3, D3, C-sharp 3, B2, and A2.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
